item.title: Demeo x Dungeons & Dragons: Battlemarked Brings D&D To VR Today
item.content:encoded:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

In 2021, Resolution Games released Demeo, which brought the classic Dungeons & Dragons style of tabletop RPG experience to virtual reality on the Meta Quest, and eventually to PlayStation platforms both in and out of VR. Today, the RPG changes from "D+D-like" to simply "D+D," as Demeo x Dungeons & Dragons: Battlemarked, in partnership with Wizards of the Coast, launches on PS5, PC, and VR platforms.

Battlemarked lets up to four players join together in one of two campaigns set in the Forgotten Realms, with each player choosing between six classes: Bard, Fighter, Paladin, Ranger, Rogue, and Sorcerer. Persistent character progression will allow players to level up and set ability points as they see fit, and those characters will not reset once the campaign has ended, so players can choose them as much as they like.

The two campaigns launching today with Demeo x Dungeons & Dragons: Battlemarked are as follows:

  • Embers of Chaos, in which players "uncover a goblin conspiracy in Neverwinter Wood and descend into the volcanic depths beneath Mount Hotenow."
  • Crown of Frost, which features "a frost giant uprising in Icewind Dale" where players will "trek from Ten Towns to the icy halls of Frost Keep."

Resolution Games has announced that it will continue to support Battlemarked post-launch with both new campaigns and new characters. While nothing has been officially announced, Resolution did say that "additional campaigns are planned as DLC throughout 2026 and beyond, expanding adventures across iconic Forgotten Realms locations."

Demeo x Dungeons & Dragons: Battlemarked is available now on PlayStation 5 and PlayStation VR 2, PC on Steam, and Meta Quest devices for $30.

Got a news tip or want to contact us directly? Email news@gamespot.com



https://www.gamespot.com/articles/demeo-x-dungeons-dragons-battlemarked-brings-dd-to-vr-today/1100-6536375/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

item.title: Dragon Generations Codes November 2025 For Free Zeni, Outfits, And More
item.content:encoded:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Dragon Generations, formerly known as Dragon Ball Online Generations, or DBOG, is a Roblox game which sees you training as a Super Saiyan, just like your favorite heroes from the popular anime series. With Dragon Ball Online Generations codes, that process becomes far easier as you can unlock experience bonuses, currency, and more. If you're falling down the Roblox rabbit hole, we've also got all of the latest Dress to Impress codes, as well as the most up to date Grow a Garden codes.

New Dragon Generations codes

These are the currently active DBOG codes:

  • DELAYEDPATCHES - One hour of double EXP
  • THANKYOUFOR50MVISITS! - 250,000 Zeni
  • BOSSESFIXEDFINALLY?! - One hour of double EXP
  • VALENTINESEVENTBOOST!! - One hour of double EXP
  • DAIMAHYPE!!! - Turtle Hermit Gi Outfit
  • A21FINALLY - One hour of double EXP
  • DAIMASFINALLYHERE! - Double drops for one hour
  • DAIMAWONDERLAND! - Double Zeni for one hour
  • PATHSSOON! - One hour of double EXP
  • PATHSBUGFIXING! - Double Zeni for one hour
  • PATHSREDESIGN! - Free character re-customize
  • SORRYFORSHUTDOWNPATHS - Free character re-customize

How to redeem codes in Dragon Generations

To redeem codes in Dragon Generations follow these steps:

  • Open the game's menu by pressing M
  • Click Options
  • Click Codes
  • Enter your code
  • Hit redeem
  • Enjoy your rewards

You can bookmark this page and return to it when you're out of codes, as we'll regularly be updating our list with the latest ones. If you can't wait that long, you can also head to the official Dragon Generations Discord server to see if any have been posted recently.

Got a news tip or want to contact us directly? Email news@gamespot.com



https://www.gamespot.com/articles/dragon-generations-codes/1100-6536397/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

item.title: GTA Online's Long-Awaited Mansions Update Is Coming Soon
item.content:encoded:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

If you've been playing Grand Theft Auto Online long enough, you should have a pretty hefty amount of cash on hand. Next month, you'll be able to put that money to good use as the new update--A Safehouse in the Hills--introduces mansions that you can claim as your own.

These multi-million estates are under the purview of the Prix Luxury Real Estate company, which promises "sprawling grounds, breathtaking views, and first-rate amenities--including the latest in personal assistance and business service technology." While a price range for the mansions wasn't disclosed, players may wish they took part in the recent giveaway of free in-game currency.

Rockstar Games hasn't disclosed an exact date in December for the launch of A Safehouse in the Hills, but GTA Online players who opt into a Prix Luxury Black Tier VIP from now through December 7 can grab an Ubermacht Revolter sports car at the Luxury Autos showroom. Players can advance to the Gold Tier membership by finishing all three New Listings missions, which will reward users with a $1 million bonus of in-game cash, as well as a $2 million discount on one of the luxury estates being offered by Prix Luxury.

Rockstar hasn't signaled its intentions for GTA Online following the arrival of Grand Theft Auto 6, because GTA Online is the real cash cow of the franchise according a video game analyst. Earlier this month, Rockstar added GTA Online to its GTA+ membership service.

Got a news tip or want to contact us directly? Email news@gamespot.com



https://www.gamespot.com/articles/gta-onlines-long-awaited-mansions-update-is-coming-soon/1100-6536396/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f
